intro: Cordillera platycalyx, commonly known as the broad-calyx mountain plant, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Andes. Cordillera platycalyx is adapted to cold, nutrient-poor soils and is an important species in the ecological diversity of high-altitude ecosystems.
